title: US travelers scramble to adjust as airlines cut flights because of shutdown
byline: Hundreds of flight cancellations spread across the U.S. on Friday as airlines began complying with the Federal Aviation Administration’s unprecedented order to reduce service nationwide because of the government shutdown.

title: Fairly heavy rainfall expected in parts of the island
byline: The Meteorology Department states that showers or thundershowers will occur in most parts of the island after 1.00 p.m.

title: DNA pioneer James Watson dies at 97
byline: Nobel Prize-winning American scientist James Watson, one of the co-discoverers of the structure of DNA, has died aged 97.

title: 2026 Budget Debate to begin today
byline: The debate on the Second Reading of the Appropriation Bill for the year 2026 is scheduled to commence today (08) and will continue for six days, until November 14.

title: Bail applications of Mahindananda Aluthgamage and Nalin Fernando rejected
byline: The Colombo Permanent High Court Trial-at-Bar has ordered the rejection of bail applications filed by former ministers Mahindananda Aluthgamage and Nalin Fernando, who were convicted and sentenced to rigorous imprisonment in the “carrom board case”, as both have filed appeals against their sentences.

title: James Watson, famous geneticist and Nobel Prize co-winner in the structure of DNA, dies at 97
byline: James Watson, a renowned molecular biologist and one of the Nobel Prize winners for discovering the structure of DNA, died Thursday after a brief illness, according to a statement from his former employer.

title: STF nab 03 suspects with large haul of heroin in Galle
byline: The Police Special Task Force (STF) has arrested three individuals today (08) in possession of a large quantity of heroin during a raid conducted in the Seenigama area of Galle, police said.

title: World’s biggest spiderweb home to more than 110,000 spiders discovered on the Albanian-Greek border
byline: Researchers have discovered more than 111,000 spiders thriving in what appears to be the world’s largest spider web, deep inside a pitch-black cave on the Albanian-Greek border.

title: Kendrick Lamar and Lady Gaga lead 2026 Grammy nominations
byline: Lady Gaga and Kendrick Lamar lead the nominees for the 2026 Grammy Awards, while K-Pop has broken into the song of the year category for the first time.

title: Sivakarthikeyan-Sai Pallavi’s Amaran to open at IFFI 2025, nominated for Golden Peacock award
byline: Sivakarthikeyan and Sai Pallavi’s blockbuster 2024 film Amaran, directed by Rajkumar Periyasamy continues to earn laurels a year after its release.

title: Kotahena shooting victim identified as associate of ‘Pukudu Kanna’
byline: Investigations have revealed that the individual who was killed in the shooting incident in the Kotahena area last night (07) was an associate of notorious underworld figure Balachandran Pushparaj, also known as “Pukudu Kanna.”

title: Turkey issues genocide arrest warrant against Netanyahu
byline: Turkey announced Friday that it had issued arrest warrants for genocide against Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and senior officials in his government over the war in Gaza.

title: Over 1,000 arrested in nationwide anti-drug raids
byline: A total of 1,087 suspects were arrested during island-wide raids conducted within yesterday (07) under the “Nation United – National Drive” campaign aimed at eradicating narcotics from the country.

title: Couple arrested with heroin and ‘Ice’ in Divulapitiya
byline: Officers of the Anti-Vice Unit of the Divulapitiya Police Station have busted a drug racket allegedly operated by a couple over a long period of time.

title: FM Vijitha Herath invites global fintech firm to invest in Sri Lanka
byline: Minister of Foreign Affairs, Foreign Employment, and Tourism, Vijitha Herath, said that he held a productive meeting with the CEO of GTN Global and his team.

title: Advisory issued for severe lightning
byline: An ‘Amber’ advisory has been issued by the Department of Meteorology for severe lightning in several provinces and districts.

title: Denmark’s government aims to ban access to social media for children under 15
byline: Denmark’s government on Friday announced an agreement to ban access to social media for anyone under 15, ratcheting up pressure on Big Tech platforms as concerns grow that kids are getting too swept up in a digitized world of harmful content and commercial interests.

title: 2026 Budget reflects unprecedented economic discipline – CCC Chairman
byline: The 2026 Budget is a budget with unprecedented economic discipline, says Krishan Balendra, Chairman of Ceylon Chamber of Commerce (CCC).

title: Indian intel agencies warn Dawood Ibrahim’s drug cartel now working with LTTE – report
byline: Indian Intelligence agencies have been flagging concerns about the Dawood Ibrahim syndicate trying to explore routes through South India to further their drug business.

title: Sri Lanka’s special relationship with India must be protected – Sajith
byline: In the latest episode of India Ascends on NDTV, Sri Lanka’s Leader of the Opposition Sajith Premadasa discussed the future of India–Sri Lanka relations, the rise of China in the Indo-Pacific, and the country’s fragile financial outlook.

title: Ceylon Chamber welcomes Budget 2026, calls for swift implementation of reforms
byline: The Ceylon Chamber of Commerce has welcomed the National Budget 2026, stating that it reinforces policy predictability, fiscal consolidation, and disciplined debt management—elements critical for sustaining Sri Lanka’s medium-term reform agenda.

title: Three vehicles belonging to Sampath Manamperi seized in Middeniya
byline: Three vehicles allegedly owned by Sampath Manamperi, who is currently being held under a detention order, have been seized by officers of the Western Province North Crimes Division.

title: NFF will not join opposition rally on Nov. 21 – Wimal
byline: The National Freedom Front (NFF) has announced that the party will not participate in the rally organized by a coalition of several opposition parties, scheduled to be held on November 21.

title: Three more suspects arrested over heroin seizure in Seenigama
byline: Three more suspects have been arrested in connection with the recent seizure of a stock of heroin in the Seenigama area and the arrest of three individuals.

title: Leasing facility rates for motor vehicles revised
byline: The Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL), in its capacity as the Macroprudential Authority has issued directions to licensed commercial banks and licensed specialised banks, Licensed Finance Companies (LFCs) and Registered Finance Leasing Establishments (RFLEs) for the implementation of maximum caps on loan-to-value (LTV) ratio...

title: 175 nursing lecturer vacancies to be filled immediately – Health Minister
byline: The Minister of Health and Mass Media, Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa, has instructed officials to urgently recruit nursing lecturers due to a significant shortage in nursing schools.

title: Three including woman arrested over Kotahena shooting
byline: Three suspects including a woman have been apprehended in connection with the Kotahena shooting incident that claimed the life of one individual last night (07).

title: Sri Lankan boat with nearly 300kg heroin and ‘Ice’ seized off Maldives
byline: Six Sri Lankan fishermen along with a fishing vessel carrying nearly 300 kilograms of heroin and ‘Ice’ (crystal methamphetamine) have been arrested by the Maldivian Coast Guard.

title: Tornado in southern Brazil kills six, injures hundreds
byline: A tornado accompanied by strong winds and heavy rain struck the southern Brazilian state of Parana, killing six people, the state government said on Saturday.

title: Sri Lanka’s apparel exporters urges key reforms at Colombo Port to stay competitive
byline: An apex body of Sri Lanka’s apparel exporters on Friday demanded reforms at the Colombo port and claimed that traders are losing their competitiveness in the region due to its efficiency plagued by delays.
